page.title: 19Wild birds at Pitsford
page.content: The Northamptonshire Naturalists Trust has leased from the Anglian Water Authority some 48O acres of land adjacent to the reservoir as a{nature {reserve.}The reserve has water, reed bed and woodland habitats. Access is resricted to permit holders. A visit was made to the reserve on 4th.July, 1985, accompanied by Matthew Rodgers of the Trust. He identified{23 breeds}of bird during a two hour visit, including carrion crow, coot, mute swan, lapwing, yellow hammer, swift, pochard, great crested grebe, cuckoo, marsh warbler, marsh-tit, wren, chaffinch, sedge-warbler, ruddy duck, black headed gull and gadwall. The best time to visit the reserve is during{winter}when the number of over-wintering birds may reach 5O,OOO.
